Question: What is the name of your data center network modernization project?
Guidance: Provide internal project reference name

Question: Who is the primary stakeholder for this network infrastructure project?
Guidance: Name, role, and decision-making authority
Notes: Main point of contact and decision authority

Question: What network challenges are you trying to solve with PowerSwitch infrastructure?
Guidance: Common challenges: Aging Cisco infrastructure end-of-life, High SmartNet costs, Insufficient bandwidth for cloud-native apps, Lack of automation, Complex multi-vendor management
Notes: Primary business driver for network modernization

Question: What is your current data center network infrastructure?
Guidance: Describe core/distribution/access layers, switch vendors (Cisco, Arista, Juniper), bandwidth, and pain points

Question: How many server racks are in your data center?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 10-20 racks
column10: Determines spine-leaf scale and switch quantity

Question: What applications run in your data center?
Guidance: Common types: Virtualization (VMware, Hyper-V), Kubernetes/containers, Storage (SAN/NAS), Database clusters, Cloud-native microservices
Notes: Workload classification drives bandwidth and latency requirements

Question: What are your primary goals for deploying PowerSwitch network?
Guidance: Common goals: Reduce Cisco costs, Increase bandwidth (25/100GbE), Enable automation, Support VXLAN multi-tenancy, Simplify operations

Question: How will you measure network deployment success?
Guidance: Define KPIs: Cost savings vs Cisco baseline, Latency reduction, Zero outages during migration, Automation adoption, Time to provision new VLANs

Question: What is your expected timeline for network deployment and migration?
Guidance: Typical ranges: 0-4 weeks pilot, 1-3 months phased rollout, 3-6 months full deployment
Notes: Project timeline expectations and migration windows

Question: What is your approved budget range for network infrastructure?
Guidance: Common ranges: $500K-$1M, $1M-$2M, $2M-$5M, $5M+. Include both CapEx (hardware) and OpEx (support)

Question: What is your long-term vision for data center networking?
Guidance: Consider expansion to more racks, multi-site interconnect, hybrid cloud, SDN orchestration

Question: How do you expect rack count and bandwidth needs to change over 3 years?
Guidance: Provide current rack count and projected annual growth rate (10%, 25%, 50%)

Question: What network topology do you currently use?
Guidance: Common topologies: Traditional 3-tier (core/distribution/access), Spine-leaf (Clos), Collapsed core, Hybrid
Notes: Current architecture baseline for migration planning

Question: Are you interested in spine-leaf (Clos) fabric architecture?
Guidance: Spine-leaf provides 3:1 oversubscription with any-to-any bandwidth and horizontal scalability

Question: What server uplink bandwidth is required per rack?
Guidance: Options: 1GbE adequate, 10GbE standard, 25GbE preferred, 40GbE high-performance

Question: What spine fabric bandwidth is required?
Guidance: Options: 40GbE spines, 100GbE spines (standard), 400GbE spines (future-ready)

Question: How many servers per rack on average?
Guidance: Typical: 10-20 servers/rack (enterprise), 30-40 servers/rack (dense), 40+ servers/rack (hyperscale)
Notes: Determines leaf switch port count (48-port vs 96-port)

Question: What network services must the fabric support?
Guidance: Services: VLANs only, VXLAN overlay, BGP EVPN, Multi-tenancy, QoS, Multicast

Question: What routing protocol preference do you have?
Guidance: Options: OSPF (traditional), BGP (modern spine-leaf standard), EIGRP (Cisco legacy), IS-IS

Question: Do you need network virtualization (VXLAN overlay)?
Guidance: VXLAN with EVPN provides multi-tenancy and Layer 2 stretch across spine-leaf fabric

Question: What network management approach do you prefer?
Guidance: Options: CLI only, Web GUI (OS10 Enterprise), Centralized (SmartFabric), Automation (Ansible/Python)

Question: What network automation capabilities do you need?
Guidance: Capabilities: Zero-touch provisioning (ZTP), Configuration templates, Ansible playbooks, Python scripting, GitOps

Question: What existing network vendor equipment will be replaced?
Guidance: Common vendors: Cisco (Nexus, Catalyst), Arista, Juniper, HP/Aruba, Brocade

Question: Do you have dependencies on Cisco-specific features?
Guidance: Cisco features: vPC (use VLT on Dell), FabricPath (use VXLAN), Nexus 1000V (use NSX)

Question: Must PowerSwitch interoperate with existing vendor equipment during migration?
Guidance: Common: Cisco core during transition, Arista leaf, Juniper WAN edge

Question: What Dell OS10 version and features are required?
Guidance: OS10 versions: Enterprise (full features), Enterprise Lite (subset), consider automation needs

Question: What cabling infrastructure exists in the data center?
Guidance: Cabling: Copper DAC (short-reach), Fiber multimode (100m), Fiber singlemode (long-reach 10km+)

Question: What network redundancy is required?
Guidance: Redundancy: Single ToR acceptable, Dual ToR per rack (standard), N+1 spine, Dual-plane spine-leaf

Question: What latency requirements do your applications have?
Guidance: Latency: <10ms adequate (standard apps), <2ms preferred (databases), <1ms required (HFT/HPC)

Question: What aggregate fabric throughput is required?
Guidance: Throughput: 400Gbps (10 racks 10GbE), 1Tbps (20 racks 25GbE), 1.6Tbps+ (40 racks 25GbE)

Question: How many total server ports are needed across all racks?
Guidance: Calculate: racks × servers/rack × ports/server. Example: 40 racks × 30 servers × 2 ports = 2400 ports

Question: Do you need out-of-band management network?
Guidance: OOB provides dedicated management access independent of production fabric

Question: What network segmentation is required?
Guidance: Segmentation: VLANs only, VXLAN multi-tenancy, Micro-segmentation, PCI DSS zones, DMZ isolation

Question: What network access control requirements apply?
Guidance: Access control: 802.1X NAC, MAC authentication, TACACS+ (Cisco ACS), RADIUS, Certificate-based

Question: What compliance standards must the network infrastructure meet?
Guidance: Common standards: SOC 2, ISO 27001, PCI DSS, HIPAA, FedRAMP, NIST 800-53

Question: What encryption is required for network traffic?
Guidance: Encryption: MACsec (Layer 2), IPsec (Layer 3), TLS (application), No encryption

Question: What audit and logging requirements do you have?
Guidance: Requirements: Syslog, SNMP traps, Configuration change audit, User access logs, Compliance reporting
Notes: Audit trail and compliance reporting needs

Question: Do you need firewall integration with the fabric?
Guidance: Firewall options: Perimeter only, Distributed firewall (NSX), Per-rack firewall, Micro-segmentation

Question: What security patching and firmware update processes apply?
Guidance: OS10 update frequency: Quarterly recommended, Critical patches within 30 days, Annual major version upgrades

Question: Are you implementing zero-trust network architecture?
Guidance: Zero trust: Micro-segmentation, Least-privilege access, Continuous verification, NSX integration

Question: Do you require DDoS protection at the network layer?
Guidance: DDoS mitigation: None, Rate limiting, Traffic scrubbing, Cloud-based protection

Question: What security monitoring is required for the network?
Guidance: Monitoring: Flow telemetry, Packet capture, IDS/IPS integration, SIEM integration, Anomaly detection

Question: Where will the PowerSwitch infrastructure be deployed?
Guidance: Options: On-premises data center, Colocation facility, Multi-site distributed, Edge locations

Question: What power and cooling capacity is available?
Guidance: Spine Z9432F: 800W, Leaf S5248F: 350W. Plan 1.5kW per rack with ToR. Ensure adequate circuits and HVAC

Question: How much rack space is available for network equipment?
Guidance: Spine: 1U per switch (4 spines = 4U), Leaf: 1U per ToR (40 ToR = 1U per rack), Aggregation: 2U per switch
Notes: Physical space and rack elevation planning

Question: How many network engineers will manage PowerSwitch infrastructure?
Guidance: Team size: 1-2 engineers (small), 3-5 engineers (medium), 6+ engineers (large enterprise)
Notes: Support team size and training requirements

Question: What is your team's experience with Dell OS10 and spine-leaf fabrics?
Guidance: Experience levels: None (Cisco only), Basic (OS10 fundamentals), Intermediate (BGP/VXLAN), Advanced (automation)

Question: What is your team's experience with Cisco NX-OS?
Guidance: Cisco expertise helps transition to OS10 (similar CLI). OS10 provides Cisco-like interface for Nexus admins

Question: What is your team's experience with network automation?
Guidance: Automation skills: None (CLI only), Basic (scripts), Intermediate (Ansible), Advanced (Python/GitOps)

Question: What uptime requirements do you have for the network?
Guidance: Common: Best-effort 99% (no HA), Business 99.9% (dual ToR), Mission-critical 99.99% (dual-plane)

Question: What network monitoring and alerting tools do you use?
Guidance: Monitoring: SNMP only, Nagios/Zabbix, SolarWinds, Datadog, Prometheus+Grafana, Vendor NMS

Question: What support coverage do you require from Dell?
Guidance: Options: Next business day (NBD), 4-hour response (ProSupport Plus), 2-hour mission-critical, 24x7 TAM

Question: What change management windows are available for network maintenance?
Guidance: Change windows: Weekends only, Monthly maintenance window, Quarterly major changes, Zero-downtime required

Question: What is your preferred migration approach?
Guidance: Options: Forklift (cutover weekend), Phased rack-by-rack, Parallel fabric (gradual), Pilot rack first

Question: Who will be the technical lead for this network deployment project?
Guidance: Name, role, contact information

Question: What internal resources are available for deployment and migration?
Guidance: List team members, roles, and time commitment (hours per week)
Notes: Resource planning and project timeline feasibility

Question: Do you need Dell ProDeploy services for installation and configuration?
Guidance: ProDeploy: Rack installation, Cable management, Initial configuration, Validation testing
Notes: Professional services and on-site support needs

Question: What pilot rack or workload will validate the PowerSwitch fabric?
Guidance: Pilot selection: Non-critical rack, Development environment, Specific application tier

Question: What is your preferred phased rollout strategy?
Guidance: Options: Pilot rack Week 1-2, 5-10 racks every weekend, 25% capacity per month, All at once

Question: What application downtime is acceptable during migration?
Guidance: Downtime: Maintenance window (4 hours), Brief outage (30 min), Zero downtime (vMotion/live migration)

Question: What training will be needed for network team?
Guidance: Types: OS10 CLI, BGP/VXLAN, SmartFabric, Ansible automation, Troubleshooting

Question: What documentation is required for handover?
Guidance: Deliverables: Network diagrams, IP address plan, BGP AS design, Runbooks, Troubleshooting guides

Question: What testing is required before production cutover?
Guidance: Testing: Connectivity validation, Throughput benchmarks, Failover testing, Application validation, Security testing

Question: What criteria must be met before PowerSwitch is production-ready?
Guidance: Examples: Pilot validated, Team trained, Monitoring operational, Cisco parallel fabric decommissioned

Question: What are your concerns about migrating from Cisco to Dell PowerSwitch?
Guidance: Consider: Feature parity, Team retraining, Vendor relationship, Support quality, CLI differences
Notes: Primary implementation concerns and risk factors

Question: How do you plan to avoid vendor lock-in with PowerSwitch?
Guidance: Open standards (BGP, VXLAN) provide portability. OS10 Linux-based. Avoid proprietary protocols (use standards)

Question: What happens if you need more capacity than initially deployed?
Guidance: Options: Add spine switches (up to 8), Add leaf switches per rack, Upgrade optics (25GbE to 100GbE)

Question: What is your tolerance for network hardware failures?
Guidance: Failed leaf affects one rack (dual ToR mitigates). Failed spine reduces bandwidth (N+1 spine recommended)
Notes: Failure mode analysis and mitigation strategies

Question: What is your biggest concern about spine-leaf migration?
Guidance: Common: Downtime during cutover, BGP/VXLAN complexity, Application compatibility, Team learning curve

Question: What constraints must the network solution work within?
Guidance: Consider: CapEx limits, OpEx annual budget, Approval processes, Cisco SmartNet renewal deadline
Notes: Solution design boundaries and financial constraints

Question: Are there any deadlines driving the network deployment timeline?
Guidance: Common: Cisco end-of-life, SmartNet renewal, Data center lease, Compliance audit, Rack expansion project

Question: What is your biggest concern about managing Dell PowerSwitch?
Guidance: Common: OS10 CLI learning curve, BGP troubleshooting, VXLAN debugging, Lack of Cisco expertise transfer
Notes: Skill development and external support requirements

Question: What is your current annual Cisco SmartNet or support cost?
Guidance: Calculate annual support: SmartNet typically 18-22% of hardware list price. Example: $1M Cisco hardware = $200K/year SmartNet
Notes: ROI baseline for cost comparison analysis

Question: What Cisco equipment will PowerSwitch replace?
Guidance: Common Cisco: Nexus 9K (spine/leaf), Nexus 7K (core), Catalyst 6500 (distribution), Catalyst 2960/3750 (access)

Question: What is your Cisco hardware end-of-life status and refresh cost?
Guidance: Cisco refresh quote vs Dell PowerSwitch. Example: Nexus 9K refresh $3.5M vs PowerSwitch $2.3M (35% savings)

Question: What ROI timeline and payback period are you targeting?
Guidance: PowerSwitch typically achieves ROI in 18-24 months vs Cisco refresh through lower CapEx and OpEx savings

Question: Do you have preferences or constraints around CapEx vs OpEx spending?
Guidance: Consider: Dell Financial Services leasing (converts CapEx to OpEx), budget approval processes, cash flow
